trans-unit.source: Connect to a Machine Learning Web Service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Connect to a Machine Learning Web Service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: With C# or Python, connect to an Azure Machine Learning web service using an authorization key.
trans-unit.target: With C# or Python, connect to an Azure Machine Learning web service using an authorization key.

trans-unit.source: Connect to an Azure Machine Learning Web Service
trans-unit.target: Connect to an Azure Machine Learning Web Service

trans-unit.source: The Azure Machine Learning developer experience is a web service API to make predictions from input data in real time or in batch mode.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Machine Learning developer experience is a web service API to make predictions from input data in real time or in batch mode.

trans-unit.source: You use Azure Machine Learning Studio to create predictions and deploy an Azure Machine Learning web service.
trans-unit.target: You use Azure Machine Learning Studio to create predictions and deploy an Azure Machine Learning web service.

trans-unit.source: To learn about how to create and deploy a Machine Learning web service using Machine Learning Studio:
trans-unit.target: To learn about how to create and deploy a Machine Learning web service using Machine Learning Studio:

trans-unit.source: [Deploy a Machine Learning web service](machine-learning-publish-a-machine-learning-web-service.md)
trans-unit.target: [Deploy a Machine Learning web service](machine-learning-publish-a-machine-learning-web-service.md)

trans-unit.source: [Getting Started with Machine Learning Studio](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/getting-started-with-ml-studio/)
trans-unit.target: [Getting Started with Machine Learning Studio](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/getting-started-with-ml-studio/)

trans-unit.source: [Azure Machine Learning Preview](https://studio.azureml.net/)
trans-unit.target: [Azure Machine Learning Preview](https://studio.azureml.net/)

trans-unit.source: [Machine Learning Documentation Center](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/machine-learning/)
trans-unit.target: [Machine Learning Documentation Center](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/machine-learning/)

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning web service
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning web service

trans-unit.source: With the Azure Machine Learning web service, an external application communicates with a Machine Learning workflow scoring model in real time.
trans-unit.target: With the Azure Machine Learning web service, an external application communicates with a Machine Learning workflow scoring model in real time.

trans-unit.source: A Machine Learning web service call returns prediction results to an external application.
trans-unit.target: A Machine Learning web service call returns prediction results to an external application.

trans-unit.source: To make a Machine Learning web service call, you pass an API key which is created when you deploy a prediction.
trans-unit.target: To make a Machine Learning web service call, you pass an API key which is created when you deploy a prediction.

trans-unit.source: The Machine Learning web service is based on REST, a popular architecture choice for web programming projects.
trans-unit.target: The Machine Learning web service is based on REST, a popular architecture choice for web programming projects.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning has two types of services:
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning has two types of services:

trans-unit.source: Request-Response Service (RRS) – A low latency, highly scalable service that provides an interface to the stateless models created and deployed from the Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: Request-Response Service (RRS) – A low latency, highly scalable service that provides an interface to the stateless models created and deployed from the Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: Batch Execution Service (BES) – An asynchronous service that scores a batch for data records.
trans-unit.target: Batch Execution Service (BES) – An asynchronous service that scores a batch for data records.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Machine Learning web services, see [Deploy a Machine Learning web service](machine-learning-publish-a-machine-learning-web-service.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about Machine Learning web services, see [Deploy a Machine Learning web service](machine-learning-publish-a-machine-learning-web-service.md).

trans-unit.source: Get an Azure Machine Learning authorization key
trans-unit.target: Get an Azure Machine Learning authorization key

trans-unit.source: You get a web service API key from a Machine Learning web service.
trans-unit.target: You get a web service API key from a Machine Learning web service.

trans-unit.source: You can get it from Machine Learning Studio or the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get it from Machine Learning Studio or the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio

trans-unit.source: In Machine Learning Studio, click **WEB SERVICES** on the left.
trans-unit.target: In Machine Learning Studio, click **WEB SERVICES** on the left.

trans-unit.source: Click a web service.
trans-unit.target: Click a web service.

trans-unit.source: The “API key” is on the **DASHBOARD** tab.
trans-unit.target: The “API key” is on the **DASHBOARD** tab.

trans-unit.source: Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Click **MACHINE LEARNING** on the left.
trans-unit.target: Click **MACHINE LEARNING** on the left.

trans-unit.source: Click a workspace.
trans-unit.target: Click a workspace.

trans-unit.source: Click **WEB SERVICES**.
trans-unit.target: Click **WEB SERVICES**.

trans-unit.source: Click a web service.
trans-unit.target: Click a web service.

trans-unit.source: Click an endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Click an endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The “API KEY” is down at the lower-right.
trans-unit.target: The “API KEY” is down at the lower-right.

trans-unit.source: Connect to a Machine Learning web service
trans-unit.target: Connect to a Machine Learning web service

trans-unit.source: You can connect to a Machine Learning web service using any programming language that supports HTTP request and response.
trans-unit.target: You can connect to a Machine Learning web service using any programming language that supports HTTP request and response.

trans-unit.source: You can view examples in C#, Python, and R from a Machine Learning web service help page.
trans-unit.target: You can view examples in C#, Python, and R from a Machine Learning web service help page.

trans-unit.source: To view a Machine Learning Web Service API help page
trans-unit.target: To view a Machine Learning Web Service API help page

trans-unit.source: A Machine Learning API help page is created when you deploy a web service.
trans-unit.target: A Machine Learning API help page is created when you deploy a web service.

trans-unit.source: See [Azure Machine Learning Walkthrough- Deploy Web Service](machine-learning-walkthrough-5-publish-web-service.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Azure Machine Learning Walkthrough- Deploy Web Service](machine-learning-walkthrough-5-publish-web-service.md).

trans-unit.source: **To view a Machine Learning API help page** In Machine Learning Studio:
trans-unit.target: **To view a Machine Learning API help page** In Machine Learning Studio:

trans-unit.source: Choose **WEB SERVICES**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **WEB SERVICES**.

trans-unit.source: Choose a web service.
trans-unit.target: Choose a web service.

trans-unit.source: Choose **API help page** - **REQUEST/RESPONSE** or **BATCH EXECUTION**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **API help page** - **REQUEST/RESPONSE** or **BATCH EXECUTION**.

trans-unit.source: **Machine Learning API help page** The Machine Learning API help page contains details about a prediction web service.
trans-unit.target: **Machine Learning API help page** The Machine Learning API help page contains details about a prediction web service.

trans-unit.source: C# Sample
trans-unit.target: C# Sample

trans-unit.source: To connect to a Machine Learning web service, use an **HttpClient** passing ScoreData.
trans-unit.target: To connect to a Machine Learning web service, use an **HttpClient** passing ScoreData.

trans-unit.source: ScoreData contains a FeatureVector, an n-dimensional vector of numerical features that represents the ScoreData.
trans-unit.target: ScoreData contains a FeatureVector, an n-dimensional vector of numerical features that represents the ScoreData.

trans-unit.source: You authenticate to the Machine Learning service with an API key.
trans-unit.target: You authenticate to the Machine Learning service with an API key.

trans-unit.source: To connect to a Machine Learning web service, the **Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client** Nuget package must be installed.
trans-unit.target: To connect to a Machine Learning web service, the **Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client** Nuget package must be installed.

trans-unit.source: **Install Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client Nuget in Visual Studio**
trans-unit.target: **Install Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client Nuget in Visual Studio**

trans-unit.source: Publish the Download dataset from UCI: Adult 2 class dataset Web Service.
trans-unit.target: Publish the Download dataset from UCI: Adult 2 class dataset Web Service.

trans-unit.source: Click **Tools** > **Nuget Package Manager** > **Package Manager Console**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Tools** > **Nuget Package Manager** > **Package Manager Console**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Install-Package Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Install-Package Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client**.

trans-unit.source: **To run the code sample**
trans-unit.target: **To run the code sample**

trans-unit.source: Publish "Sample 1: Download dataset from UCI: Adult 2 class dataset" experiment, part of the Machine Learning sample collection.
trans-unit.target: Publish "Sample 1: Download dataset from UCI: Adult 2 class dataset" experiment, part of the Machine Learning sample collection.

trans-unit.source: Assign apiKey with the key from a web service.
trans-unit.target: Assign apiKey with the key from a web service.

trans-unit.source: See **Get an Azure Machine Learning authorization key** above.
trans-unit.target: See **Get an Azure Machine Learning authorization key** above.

trans-unit.source: Assign serviceUri with the Request URI.
trans-unit.target: Assign serviceUri with the Request URI.

trans-unit.source: Python Sample
trans-unit.target: Python Sample

trans-unit.source: To connect to a Machine Learning web service, use the **urllib2** library passing ScoreData.
trans-unit.target: To connect to a Machine Learning web service, use the **urllib2** library passing ScoreData.

trans-unit.source: ScoreData contains a FeatureVector, an n-dimensional vector of numerical features that represents the ScoreData.
trans-unit.target: ScoreData contains a FeatureVector, an n-dimensional vector of numerical features that represents the ScoreData.

trans-unit.source: You authenticate to the Machine Learning service with an API key.
trans-unit.target: You authenticate to the Machine Learning service with an API key.

trans-unit.source: **To run the code sample**
trans-unit.target: **To run the code sample**

trans-unit.source: Publish "Sample 1: Download dataset from UCI: Adult 2 class dataset" experiment, part of the Machine Learning sample collection.
trans-unit.target: Publish "Sample 1: Download dataset from UCI: Adult 2 class dataset" experiment, part of the Machine Learning sample collection.

trans-unit.source: Assign apiKey with the key from a web service.
trans-unit.target: Assign apiKey with the key from a web service.

trans-unit.source: See **Get an Azure Machine Learning authorization key** above.
trans-unit.target: See **Get an Azure Machine Learning authorization key** above.

trans-unit.source: Assign serviceUri with the Request URI.
trans-unit.target: Assign serviceUri with the Request URI.

trans-unit.source: See How to get a Request URI.
trans-unit.target: See How to get a Request URI.
